programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de eerste aflevering staat de hoekschop centraal. Wat is het geheim van een goede hoekschop en waarom veert het thuispubliek altijd op terwijl maar 4 procent van alle hoekschoppen een goal oplevert? Met hulp van o.a. analyticus Arnold Bruggink, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én cornerspecialist Nourdin Boukhari gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Go Ahead Eagles is bezig aan een nu al historisch seizoen. De club is regerend bekerwinnaar én reuzendoder in de Eredivisie en Europa League. De opmars van rood en geel is te zien in een gloednieuwe reeks van Home of Eus, de documentaireserie van Özcan Akyol (Eus). In de eerste aflevering onderzoekt Eus hoe Go Ahead Eagles zich klaarmaakt voor het grootste seizoen uit haar clubhistorie. En dat terwijl 'Kowet' nog maar zeven jaar geleden bivakkeerde in de kelder van de Eerste Divisie.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Heracles is begin jaren 70 een bescheiden middenmoter in de Eerste Divisie. Flinke nederlagen zijn eerder regel dan uitzondering. Op een natte decemberdag eind 1974 komt daar plotseling verandering in als het grote Ajax met 4-2 wordt uitgeschakeld in het KNVB bekertoernooi. Spelers als Hannes Lalopua, Warry Grobben, Jan Bronkers en doelman Arend Steunenberg zijn plotseling helden en denken nog dagelijks terug aan een van de meest legendarische wedstrijden uit de clubhistorie van Heracles.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Voetbal Geeft
programme.desc: Henny (77) kan met recht superfan van FC Eindhoven genoemd worden: haar huis is een mini-museum van De Blauwwitten. Tijdens één van de bijeenkomsten van FC Eindhoven Praat werd ze door de club verrast.

programme.desc: Verslag van de wedstrijd Heracles Almelo - Hoogeveen uit de 2e ronde van de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Heracles is begin jaren 70 een bescheiden middenmoter in de Eerste Divisie. Flinke nederlagen zijn eerder regel dan uitzondering. Op een natte decemberdag eind 1974 komt daar plotseling verandering in als het grote Ajax met 4-2 wordt uitgeschakeld in het KNVB bekertoernooi. Spelers als Hannes Lalopua, Warry Grobben, Jan Bronkers en doelman Arend Steunenberg zijn plotseling helden en denken nog dagelijks terug aan een van de meest legendarische wedstrijden uit de clubhistorie van Heracles.

programme.title: AIG Women's Open Official Film
programme.desc: The official film of the 2025 AIG Women's Open. Taking place at Royal Porthcawl in Wales, Japan's Miyu Yamashita claimed victory - finishing two shots clear at the summit.

programme.title: Open Championship Film 2025
programme.desc: The official film of the 153rd Open Championship. Taking place at Royal Portrush in Northern Ireland, Scottie Scheffler became champion golfer of the year for the first time in his career.

programme.title: You Can Play Golf
programme.desc: The story of four unique individuals, each of whom have overcome major obstacles to realise their ambition of simply playing golf. Hosted by three-time Major winner Padraig Harrington.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The concluding round of the Alfred Dunhill Championship, a DP World Tour event held at Royal Johannesburg Club in South Africa. (14.12)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights

programme.title: ATP Final: Buenos Aires
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca's soaring career hits new heights, as the 18-year-old becomes the youngest ATP clay finalist since Carlos Alcaraz when he faces Francisco Cerundolo in Buenos Aires. (16.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rouen
programme.desc: In Rouen, top seed Elina Svitolina - entering her first final since January last year - faces Serbia's Olga Danilovic, the third seed, for the title. (20.04)

programme.title: Agassi v Martin 1999
programme.desc: Andre Agassi's 1999 career renaissance concluded with an unforgettable victory at the US Open, earning a fifth Grand Slam title at the expense of his fellow countryman Todd Martin.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1981
programme.desc: In winning the 1981 US Open men's singles title, John McEnroe inflicted a career-ending defeat upon long-time rival Bjorn Borg, as the Swede later retired from the professional game.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1980
programme.desc: With the French Open and Wimbledon secured, Bjorn Borg met defending champion John McEnroe in the men's singles final at the 1980 US Open. Borg was bidding for his first US Open title.

programme.title: Connors v Borg 1976
programme.desc: Home favourite Jimmy Connors fought the number two seed Bjorn Borg in the finale to the men's singles at the 1976 US Open. Borg dispatched champion Manuel Orantes en route to the final.

programme.title: ATP Finals: Turin Final
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz faces Italy's reigning ATP Finals champion Jannik Sinner in their sixth meeting of the year, marking the finale to the 2025 Tour season in Turin. (16.11)

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: WTA Finals
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina - both undefeated in Riyadh - bid to become a first-time WTA Finals champion. This is the 14th meeting between the two, with Sabalenka 8-5 ahead. (08.11)

programme.title: ATP Finals: Turin Final
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz faces Italy's reigning ATP Finals champion Jannik Sinner in their sixth meeting of the year, marking the finale to the 2025 Tour season in Turin. (16.11)

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: Live: ATP Next Gen
programme.desc: The opening day of play at the 2025 Next Gen ATP Finals, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: WTA Cincinnati 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the women's singles at the Cincinnati Open, a WTA Tour 1000 hard-court event.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: Live: ATP Next Gen
programme.desc: The opening day of play at the 2025 Next Gen ATP Finals, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: ATP Final: Barcelona
programme.desc: Bidding for his second title in seven days, world number two Carlos Alcaraz sets his sights on his third Barcelona Open win, facing Denmark's Holger Rune in the final. (20.04)

programme.title: ATP Finals: Turin Final
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz faces Italy's reigning ATP Finals champion Jannik Sinner in their sixth meeting of the year, marking the finale to the 2025 Tour season in Turin. (16.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Stuttgart
programme.desc: In Stuttgart, world number one Aryna Sabalenka, a three-time runner-up in this competition, meets Jelena Ostapenko for a clash in the final. (21.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Hobart
programme.desc: A two-time winner of the Hobart International, Elise Mertens returns to the final for a fourth time as the Belgian number two seed takes on the unseeded American McCartney Kessler. (11.01)

programme.title: Djokovic v Federer 2015
programme.desc: In the final of the 2015 US Open, Novak Djokovic battled past Roger Federer to secure his second title at Flushing Meadows, and a 10th Grand Slam overall for the Serb.

programme.title: Del Potro v Federer 2009
programme.desc: With US Open title number six within reach, the Swiss maestro Roger Federer came up against a young Argentine by the name of Juan Martin del Potro in the final of the 2009 Grand Slam.

programme.title: Murray v Nadal 2008
programme.desc: At the 2008 US Open, Sir Andy Murray came up against the number one seed Rafael Nadal in the men's singles semi-final at Louis Armstrong Stadium. Roger Federer would await in the final.

programme.title: Federer v Agassi 2005
programme.desc: In the twilight of his career, Andre Agassi defied expectations by reaching the final at the 2005 US Open, coming up against Roger Federer. The American would go on to retire a year later.

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: The China Open climax sees Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz get set for a second final meeting. Sinner aims to defend the crown, while Alcaraz looks to avenge last year's defeat.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a rematch of the 2023 Madrid Open final, world number one Iga Swiatek and defending champion Aryna Sabalenka meet again to determine this year's women's singles champion.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rotterdam
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: US Open: Alcaraz v Sinner
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz play out the next chapter in their rivalry as the reigning champion and the 2022 winner compete for the US Open crown in New York. (07.09)

programme.title: ATP Final: Tokyo
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz and former finalist Taylor Fritz - the top two seeds - go one on one for the title. Fritz got the better of Alcaraz in last week's Laver Cup meeting. (30.09)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: A US Open finalist one month prior, Caroline Wozniacki's 2014 WTA Finals campaign got underway against then world number two Maria Sharapova in Singapore.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras met in the 2001 Indian Wells final - one of 34 career meetings. Agassi eyed a second consecutive win over Sampras in their first meeting in over a year.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In the 1996 Indian Wells final, Steffi Graf - having made her competitive return after a four-month injury layoff - would compete with Spain's Conchita Martinez for the title.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a battle of generations, two of the all-time greats Roger Federer and Andre Agassi fought for the year-end championship in 2003. Federer was aiming for his first title on American soil.

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: US Open: Alcaraz v Sinner
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz play out the next chapter in their rivalry as the reigning champion and the 2022 winner compete for the US Open crown in New York. (07.09)

programme.title: ATP Final: Tokyo
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz and former finalist Taylor Fritz - the top two seeds - go one on one for the title. Fritz got the better of Alcaraz in last week's Laver Cup meeting. (30.09)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rotterdam
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Toronto
programme.desc: Ben Shelton features in his first ATP Masters final as the 22-year-old eyes world number six status against Karen Khachanov, who ends a seven-year wait to compete on this stage. (07.08)

programme.title: WTA Finals
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina - both undefeated in Riyadh - bid to become a first-time WTA Finals champion. This is the 14th meeting between the two, with Sabalenka 8-5 ahead. (08.11)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Clinching the fifth of her eight Miami Open titles, Serena Williams would have to overcome one of her great rivals Justine Henin as the pair met in a highly anticipated 2007 final.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Saving four match points in the process, Roger Federer was pushed to the limit in his 2014 ATP Finals semi-final meeting with fellow Swiss superstar Stan Wawrinka.

programme.title: ATP Final: Metz
programme.desc: Britain's Cam Norrie makes his return to the final in Metz as last year's Moselle Open runner-up attempts to go one better against American NextGen star Learner Tien at the ATP 250. (08.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Montreal
programme.desc: Rising Canadian star Victoria Mboko's miracle Montreal run continues as the 18-year-old meets four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka in her first tour-level final. (07.08)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hong Kong
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of ATP Hong Kong.

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01)

programme.title: Billie Jean King: My Story
programme.desc: Billie Jean King discusses her life story, including her ongoing fight for equality and the victories on and off the court that have shaped her into the legend she is today.

programme.title: WTA Final: Brisbane
programme.desc: World number one Aryna Sabalenka looks to claim a second Brisbane International title, after success in 2023, against qualifier Polina Kudermetova. (05.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: US Open: Sabalenka v Anisimova
programme.desc: Amanda Anisimova, the home favourite, faces Aryna Sabalenka, the defending US Open champion, as the American competes in her second consecutive Grand Slam final. (06.09)

programme.title: Martina Navratilova: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Martina Navratilova sits down with Gigi Salmon for an in-depth interview about her life, tennis career and the challenges she has overcome.

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a match that would decide the 2016 year-end world number one, Andy Murray - looking to cap a storybook season at The O2 in London - met rival Novak Djokovic at the ATP Finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Adding the Doha title to her successful Australian Open defence, Victoria Azarenka kept Serena Williams at bay as the top two seeds served up a memorable final in 2013.

programme.title: Legends Tour Golf Magazine
programme.desc: Firmly established on the Legends Tour calendar, a look at the MCB Mauritius Legends - held at Constance Belle Mare Plage.

programme.title: Beyond The Scorecard
programme.desc: After losing his mother to lung cancer, Josh Simpson shares how golf became his outlet as he attempts to break the world record for most courses played in a year. (1 of 5)

programme.title: Mauritius Open 2018 Highlights
programme.desc: Day four of the AfrAsia Bank Mauritius Open on the European Tour from Domaine de Bel Ombre in Mauritius. This is just the fourth year in which this event has been held.

programme.title: Players Championship 2011 Film
programme.desc: A look back on the 2011 Players Championship from TPC Sawgrass. It was a thrilling competition and would come down to a play-off between KJ Choi and David Toms.

programme.title: Best of The SkyZone
programme.desc: A look at all the best moments from the Sky Zone at an eventful US Open at the world-famous Pebble Beach Golf Links in California.

programme.title: Best of The Sky Zone
programme.desc: A look at the very best moments from the Sky Zone at the 2019 PGA Championship at Bethpage Black Course.

programme.title: Golf Academy:Harrington Short Game
programme.desc: The Golf Academy offers guidance and all the key tips and tricks on how to make your golfing game even stronger. Here, Padraig Harrington on how to improve your short game.

programme.title: Golf Academy: McDowell Short Game
programme.desc: Professional golfers give advice on how to improve your game across all aspects, from the tee to the green. Here, Graeme McDowell talks through the top tips for short game.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The final day of the CME Group Tour Championship at the Ritz Carlton Golf Resort. Jeeno Thitikul collected a generous $4 million winner's prize last season.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2025 Chevron Championship - the first women's Major of the 2025 season - taking place at the Club at Carlton Woods in Texas.

programme.title: U.S Women's Open Golf R4 Hlts
programme.desc: The final round of the 2025 US Women's Open, the second women's Major of the 2025 season. Maja Stark of Sweden looks to defend her lead with top-ranked Nelly Korda in contention. (01.06)

programme.title: Women's PGA Championship Hlts
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2025 KPMG Women's PGA Championship, taking place at Fields Ranch in Frisco, Texas. (22.06)

programme.title: Evian Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The final round of the Amundi Evian Championship, Europe's only women's Major, in Evian-les-Bains, France. Japanese golfer Ayaka Furue celebrated her first Major victory last year. (13.07)

programme.title: Women's Open Golf Final Round Hlts
programme.desc: Just three shots separate the top seven - led by Japan's Miyu Yamashita - as 18 holes remain at the Women's Open in Wales. England's Charley Hull forms part of the chasing pack. (03.08)

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the PIF Saudi Ladies International, a Ladies European Tour event held at Riyadh Golf Club.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Aramco Korea Championship, held at New Korea Country Club as LET and LPGA stars combine to compete in the highly competitive mixed-format event.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 PIF London Championship, a Ladies European Tour event taking place at Centurion Club in St Albans.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Aramco Houston Championship, as Golfcrest Country Club stages the mixed-format event for the first time.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Aramco China Championship at Mission Hills Golf Club in Shenzhen, China.

programme.title: Asian Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the Saudi Open - taking place at Dirab Golf and Country Club - on the Asian Tour, the official sanctioning body for professional golf in the region.

programme.title: Ryder Cup Official Film
programme.desc: The official film of the 2025 Ryder Cup, as Team Europe claimed a first away victory since 2012 - defeating Keegan Bradley's Team USA in New York at Bethpage Black.

programme.title: Beyond The Scorecard
programme.desc: Josh travels to the home of golf, St Andrews, where he connects with women transforming golf's culture, spotlighting inclusion and representation in the sport. (2 of 5)

programme.title: You Can Play Golf
programme.desc: The story of four unique individuals, each of whom have overcome major obstacles to realise their ambition of simply playing golf. Hosted by three-time Major winner Padraig Harrington.

programme.title: AIG Women's Open Official Film
programme.desc: The official film of the 2025 AIG Women's Open. Taking place at Royal Porthcawl in Wales, Japan's Miyu Yamashita claimed victory - finishing two shots clear at the summit.

programme.title: Asian Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the Saudi Open - taking place at Dirab Golf and Country Club - on the Asian Tour, the official sanctioning body for professional golf in the region.
